item.title: 财政部与美联储和联邦存款保险公司合作简化银行监管程序
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）正在主持与美联储和其他银行机构的非公开会议，他将在简化监管和协调放松监管计划方面发挥更大的作用。【原文：US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent is hosting private meetings with the Federal Reserve and other bank agencies as he takes a bigger role in streamlining oversight and coordinating plans to ease regulation.】

item.title: 美联储哈马克认为经济和利率存在广泛可能性
item.description: 克利夫兰联邦储备银行行长贝丝-哈马克（Beth Hammack）表示，由于唐纳德-特朗普总统的政策及其对经济的影响存在不确定性，她对利率走向保持开放态度。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland President Beth Hammack said she’s keeping an open mind about the direction of interest rates because of uncertainty over President Donald Trump’s policies and how they will affect the economy.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司在石油价格下滑和政府压力下下调燃油价格
item.description: 近期全球石油市场低迷，巴西国家控制的石油生产商巴西石油公司（Petroleo Brasileiro SA）在要求降低柴油价格的政治压力下，本月第二次降低柴油价格。【原文：Brazil’s state-controlled oil producer Petroleo Brasileiro SA is reducing diesel prices for the second time this month after a recent downturn in the global oil market and amid political pressure for price relief at the pump.】

item.title: 石油暴跌和英镑走强将抑制英国通胀率上升
item.description: 能源价格和美元因美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的贸易战而暴跌，将抑制英国通胀率的回升，英国通胀率的回升使英国央行对降息保持紧张。【原文：A resurgence in UK inflation that has kept the Bank of England nervous about cutting interest rates is set to be curbed by energy prices and the dollar tumbling in response to US President Donald Trump’s trade war.】

item.title: 重要矿产股票因特朗普支持该行业的迹象而反弹
item.description: 本周，美国重要矿产类股飙升，有迹象表明特朗普政府将青睐这个已成为中美贸易对峙热点的行业。【原文：US critical minerals stocks have soared this week, getting a boost from signs that the Trump administration will favor a sector that’s become a flashpoint in the trade standoff between the US and China.】

item.title: 德国技术租赁公司 Grover 即将在法庭上达成重组协议
item.description: 电子租赁公司 Grover Group 即将达成重组协议，部分债权人将接管这家德国初创公司的大部分股权。【原文：Electronics-rental company Grover Group is nearing a restructuring deal that will see some creditors take over the majority of the equity of the German startup.】

item.title: 亿万富翁巴西家族聘请列维组建多战略团队
item.description: 巴西莫雷拉-萨莱斯（Moreira Salles）家族的投资办公室聘请保罗-列维（Paul Levi）担任新成立部门的交易主管。【原文：The investment office for Brazil’s Moreira Salles family has hired Paul Levi as head of trading at a newly created division.】

item.title: 航运数据可能显示货物被转运至英国的迹象
item.description: 据经济学家称，在中国出口商发出倾销警告之际，航运数据可能显示出曾经运往美国的货物被转运至英国市场的早期迹象。【原文：Shipping data may be showing early signs of goods once destined for the US being redirected to the UK market amid warnings of dumping by Chinese exporters, according to economists.】

item.title: 美国房产税增长放缓，但更多郡突破 10,000 美元
item.description: 一项新的研究显示，与 2023 年相比，美国房主去年的房产税增长速度有所放缓，而平均税额超过 1 万美元的县的数量继续稳步增长。【原文：US homeowners saw their property taxes rise more slowly last year compared with 2023, while the number of counties where the average bill tops $10,000 continued its steady increase, according to a new study.】

item.title: 丹麦降息与欧洲央行看齐，克朗下滑考验基准利率
item.description: 丹麦中央银行将基准利率下调了四分之一个百分点，以捍卫其与欧元挂钩的做法。【原文：Denmark’s central bank lowered its benchmark interest rate by a quarter point to defend its peg to the euro in a move that matched its euro-area counterpart after recent turbulence on the financial markets.】

item.title: 坦桑尼亚威胁阻止南非和马拉维农产品进口
item.description: 如果南非和马拉维不取消对来自东非国家的货物的限制，坦桑尼亚将对从这两个国家进口的农产品设置贸易壁垒。【原文：Tanzania will impose trade barriers on agricultural imports from South Africa and Malawi if the two countries don’t lift restrictions on shipments from the East African nation.】

item.title: 谷歌在美国广告技术反垄断案中部分败诉
item.description: 联邦法官认定谷歌非法垄断了一些在线广告技术市场，这对该公司业务的关键部分造成了打击。【原文：Google was found by a federal judge to have illegally monopolized some online advertising technology markets in a blow to a key part of the company’s business.】

item.title: 天然气管道亿万富翁金德公司否认关税和人工智能担忧
item.description: 金德摩根公司（Kinder Morgan Inc.【原文：Kinder Morgan Inc. billionaire co-founder Rich Kinder has shrugged off concerns in the US natural gas industry over the impact of tariffs on exports, and that demand forecasts related to artificial intelligence may be too optimistic.】

item.title: 蓝湾投资日本债券，放弃对深跌的押注
item.description: 加拿大皇家银行蓝湾资产管理公司（RBC BlueBay Asset Management）放弃了对日本债券的长期押注，认为随着日本央行暂缓进一步加息，日本债券有望获得收益。【原文：RBC BlueBay Asset Management jettisoned its long-standing bet against Japanese bonds, wagering they are poised to gain as the nation’s central bank holds back on further interest-rate hikes.】

item.title: 随着帕特森出售交易的结束，华尔街将背负更多的收购债务
item.description: 华尔街银行因收购 Patterson Cos.公司而背负 23.5 亿美元的债务，这是自特朗普政府引发全球贸易战以来，贷款人第二次背负巨额融资包。【原文：Wall Street banks are stuck with $2.35 billion in debt for the buyout of Patterson Cos., the second time lenders have been on the hook for a big financing package since the Trump administration triggered a global trade war.】

item.title: AQR 在缓冲区大辩论中对决贝莱德
item.description:
AQR 上个月发表了一篇对缓冲器产品的激烈批评

。【原文：

AQR had published a fiery critique of buffer products last month

】

item.title: 习近平的 "二号人物 "在市场倾斜中发出对非正常政策持开放态度的信号
item.description: 中国国务院总理李强表示，政府官员需要在 "关键时刻 "采取迅速、积极的政策措施来支撑市场信心。【原文：Chinese Premier Li Qiang said government officials need to shore up market confidence at “critical moments” with prompt and proactive policy measures.】

item.title: 费城联储任命芝加哥联储安娜-保尔森为总裁
item.description: 费城联邦储备银行任命目前担任芝加哥联储研究主管的安娜-保尔森为下一任行长。【原文：The Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia appointed Anna Paulson, who currently serves as the Chicago Fed’s head of research, as its next president.】

item.title: 国泰君安私人债务 ETF 数周内无新增资金流入
item.description: 在资产管理公司集中精力吸引散户投资者之际，State Street Corp. 和 Apollo Global Management Inc.【原文：Demand for State Street Corp. and Apollo Global Management Inc.’s hotly anticipated private credit exchange-traded fund has virtually dried up, at a time when asset managers have keyed in on reaching retail investors.】

item.title: 顾问称美国与刚果的矿产交易取得进展
item.description: 一位美国高级官员表示，美国可能会通过美国进出口银行和美国国际开发金融公司向在刚果民主共和国运营的公司提供融资，作为潜在的关键矿产合作伙伴关系的一部分。【原文：The US may provide financing to companies operating in the Democratic Republic of Congo through the Export–Import Bank of the United States and the US International Development Finance Corp. as part of a potential critical minerals partnership, a senior US official said.】

item.title: 尽管贸易关系紧张，加拿大 2 月美股投资仍创纪录
item.description: 尽管抵制美国产品和假期的运动势头正劲，但加拿大人在 2 月份对美国股票的投入仍创下了历史新高。【原文：Canadians poured a record amount into US equities in February, even as a movement to boycott US products and vacations gained momentum.】

item.title: 印度财政部长称贸易形势堪忧、充满挑战
item.description: 印度财政部长表示，全球贸易形势 "充满挑战 "且 "令人担忧"，这给亚洲第三大经济体带来了压力。【原文：India’s finance minister said the global trade landscape is “challenging” and “worrisome,” putting pressure on Asia’s third-largest economy.】

item.title: CFPB 将削减对金融公司的监管，将重点从金融科技公司转移到其他领域
item.description: 美国最高级别的消费者金融监管机构已经阐明了唐纳德-特朗普时代的优先事项，包括大幅削减监管力度和放弃对金融技术公司的监督。【原文：America’s top consumer financial watchdog has spelled out its priorities under the Donald Trump era, including a dramatic cut to supervision and a shift away from financial technology firm oversight.】

item.title: 人工智能产生大量碳排放。它也开始减少碳排放
item.description:
要减少全球的碳足迹，就必须研究庞大的数据集，找出解决方案；而这正是计算机比人类做得更好、更快的地方。【原文：

Shrinking the world’s carbon footprint will require poring over vast datasets to spot solutions — something computers do better and faster than humans.

】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织称全球经济因贸易 "重启 "而放缓，但仍可避免衰退
item.description: 国际货币基金组织总裁警告说，全球经济将因美国主导的世界贸易 "重启 "而放缓，但预计不会出现衰退。【原文：The head of the International Monetary Fund warned that the global economy will slow due to the US-led world trade “reboot,” but a recession isn’t in the forecast.】

item.title: 贸易谈判出现进展迹象，标普 500 指数上涨，道指下跌 1
item.description: 周四上午，美国股市在周末假期前反弹，原因是唐纳德-特朗普总统吹捧日本贸易协议谈判取得了 "重大进展"，全球最大的芯片制造商也给出了乐观的销售预测。【原文：US equities rebounded Thursday morning ahead of the holiday weekend as President Donald Trump touted “big progress” in talks to strike a trade deal for Japan, and the world’s largest chipmaker gave an upbeat sales forecast.】

item.title: 厄瓜多尔面临与交易商的艰苦斗争，石油暴跌为反弹画上句号
item.description: 丹尼尔-诺沃亚（Daniel Noboa）以压倒性优势获胜后，本周厄瓜多尔债券大幅反弹，投资者在不可预知的大选中坚守厄瓜多尔。但他们认为，全球形势的动荡限制了更多的上涨空间。【原文：Investors who stuck with Ecuador as an unpredictable election sank its bonds surfed a massive rally this week after Daniel Noboa’s landslide victory. But rocky global conditions, they say, are capping the room for more gains.】

item.title: Pimco 警告：关税冲击后，美国市场将成为英国和新兴市场的镜像
item.description: 太平洋投资管理公司（Pacific Investment Management Co.【原文：US financial assets are at risk of “mirroring dynamics of the UK and emerging markets” as the Trump administration embraces protectionism, says Pacific Investment Management Co.】

item.title: 高盛称奈拉将因石油价格下跌而再次贬值
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易战引发油价下滑，给非洲最大原油生产国的预算造成压力，尼日利亚可能不得不再次将奈拉贬值。【原文：Nigeria may have to devalue its naira again as sliding oil prices triggered by US President Donald Trump’s trade war pressure the budget of Africa’s largest crude producer.】

item.title: 赞比亚通胀率自 2019 年以来首次达到目标
item.description: 赞比亚财政部长表示，赞比亚的年度消费价格通胀率将在年底前降至8%以下，这将是自2019年以来首次降至央行的目标范围内。【原文：Zambia’s annual consumer-price inflation is set to dip below 8% by year-end, the secretary to the treasury said, which would be the first time it falls within the central bank’s target range since 2019.】
